channel.title: Comments on: Adobe PDF files, not printable anymore?

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
Thaink aiddy for the confirmation. I didn't think it supported multimedia.
I wonder if it should to compete?
item.content:encoded:
Thaink aiddy for the confirmation. I didn’t think it supported multimedia.

I wonder if it should to compete?

item.title: By: aiddy
item.dc:creator: aiddy
item.description:
Hi Aaron, XPS doesn't support something similar since XPS is designed to be *just* what you need for electronic paper. Supporting stuff that's beyond what you can print to, or scan from, physical paper is beyond the scenarios that XPS addresses.
/aiddy
item.content:encoded:
Hi Aaron, XPS doesn’t support something similar since XPS is designed to be *just* what you need for electronic paper. Supporting stuff that’s beyond what you can print to, or scan from, physical paper is beyond the scenarios that XPS addresses.

/aiddy

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description: Yogesh -- but how would you print a video? :-)
item.content:encoded: Yogesh — but how would you print a video? :-)

item.title: By: Yogesh A
item.dc:creator: Yogesh A
item.content:encoded:
I just learnt that Adobe Acrobat reader 9 is announced along with Acrobat.com. This might solve the printing problem.
I visited Acrobat.com. Contains great features. But i got somewhat confused. But i got detailed information about it later here – Adobe introduces Acrobat 9 & Acrobat.com
It also contains detailed and fabulous review of Acrobat 9 and Acrobat.com which was a lot helpful.

Adobe Acrobat 9 – Preview
Acrobat.com (BETA)
